com.jidesoft.plaf
Class LookAndFeelFactory

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.LookAndFeel
      javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicLookAndFeel
          com.jidesoft.plaf.LookAndFeelFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class LookAndFeelFactory
extends javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicLookAndFeel

Since there are several new components that JIDE created, those components need corresponding ComponentUI classes. However since any existing look and feel will not have those ComponentUI classes, LookAndFeelFactory can take any existing look and feel and produce a look and feel which can be used by JIDE products.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

create

public static javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicLookAndFeel create(java.lang.String lookAndFeelName)
Deprecated. replace by installJideExtension(). You can set to whatever L&F as before, then call installJideExtension() or installJideExtension(int style) to add UIDefaults needed by JIDE products.

Creates a look and feel that is compatible with JIDE products.

Parameters:
lookAndFeelName - a full qualified class name of a look and feel. The look and feel must be an instance of BasicLookAndFeel.
Returns:
a look and feel that is compatible with JIDE products.

getDefaults

public javax.swing.UIDefaults getDefaults()

installJideExtension

public static void installJideExtension()
Add additional UIDefaults JIDE needed to UIDefaults table. You must call this method everytime switching look and feel. And callupdateComponentTreeUI() in corresponding DockingManager or DockableBarManager after this call. 

  try {
      UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.getSystemLookAndFeelClassName());
  }
  catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
  }
  catch (InstantiationException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
  }
  catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
      e.printStackTrace();
  }
  catch (UnsupportedLookAndFeelException e) {
      e.printStackTrace();
  }

  // to add attitional UIDefault for JIDE components
  LookAndFeelFactory.installJideExtension(); // use default style VSNET_STYLE

  // call updateComponentTreeUI
  frame.getDockableBarManager().updateComponentTreeUI();
  frame.getDockingManager().updateComponentTreeUI();

installJideExtension

public static void installJideExtension(int style)
Add additional UIDefaults JIDE needed to UIDefaults table. You must call this method everytime switching look and feel. And callupdateComponentTreeUI() in corresponding DockingManager or DockableBarManager after this call. 

  try {
      UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.getSystemLookAndFeelClassName());
  }
  catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
  }
  catch (InstantiationException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
  }
  catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
      e.printStackTrace();
  }
  catch (UnsupportedLookAndFeelException e) {
      e.printStackTrace();
  }

  // to add attitional UIDefault for JIDE components
  LookAndFeelFactory.installJideExtension(LookAndFeelFactory.OFFICE2003_STYLE);

  // call updateComponentTreeUI
  frame.getDockableBarManager().updateComponentTreeUI();
  frame.getDockingManager().updateComponentTreeUI();

Deprecated. replace by installJideExtension(). You can set to whatever L&F as before, then call installJideExtension() or installJideExtension(int style) to add UIDefaults needed by JIDE products.
